thread.title: Falcons & Blue Streaks prepare for Section 1 showdown
thread.title_full: Falcons & Blue Streaks prepare for Section 1 showdown

title: Falcons & Blue Streaks prepare for Section 1 showdown
text:
Falcons & Blue Streaks prepare for Section 1 showdown 
Updated: 
Posted by: Shannel Douglas 

MANHEIM TWP. – It’s a Lancaster-Lebanon Section 1 clash as Cedar Crest takes on Manheim Township Friday night in week 6 of the season. 

"Definitely excited for it,” says Cedar Cliff senior safety, Evan Horn. “Hopefully we can get a win" 

"If we play up to our potential I think we'll come out of there with the win,” said Manheim Township senior wide receiver, John Stutz. “We just got to play well" 

The Blue Streaks are on a hot streak winning four straight games. 

"We stay in control of our own destiny,” said Manheim Township head coach, Mark Evans. “We have to take care of business now or else the rest of it is not going to matter." 

A big part of their success is Quarterback Erik Benjamin who with 16 touchdowns and only two interceptions is one of the leading passers in AAAA. 

"Erik is one of those rare kids that comes along that just has a great command of the offense,” explains Evans. “He does a great job at keeping his eyes down field and he's tough." 

"I really couldn't do it without my line and my skill guys,” said Benjamin. “They're great. They just give me so many options for what I can do on the field." 

Cedar Crest knows this offense will be a challenge to stop. 

"He's a great quarterback,” said Horn. “And their receiver is just as good too. Definitely one of the best in the league. Just have to be prepared for what they do and see what we can do." 

The Falcons are coming off of last week’s loss putting the team at 2-3 on the season. They’re hoping to bring a winning tradition back to Lebanon. 

"That's going to take time to get us back to where we want to be,” said Cedar Crest head coach, Rob Wildasin. “But we're real close. We're a big victory here or there away from flipping the switch.” 

Cedar Crest hasn’t been able to beat Manheim Township in over 10 years. The Falcons are hoping to turn their luck around on the road Friday night. 

"I've never beat them,” said Horn. “Something I definitely want to do. Come out and play hard” 

“There are a lot of seniors so I know it would mean a lot to the school to go out on a good note,” said Cedar Crest senior right tackle, Alex Flocken. 

Cedar Crest is looking to use this game as a turning point for the season while Manheim Township is hoping to take care of business and become tied for 1 st place in Section 1. 

Kick-off is set for 7pm at Manheim Township High School. Related Stories
